title: Reloading lost emails?
content: Thunderbird tried to compact an Inbox folder that contained a large number of emails, but something went wrong and I kept getting the error message about not having enough space or authority. Eventually it stopped, but all emails in that folder back to 2021 disappeared. Tried the repairing folder option, that had no apparent effect. Now it loads new messages just fine, but all those for the last four years are absent. I have it set to leave messages on the server, and indeed they all are. So I should be able to get Thunderbird to re-load them, right? But I have searched in vain for any instructions on how to do this, and cannot figure it out. Is it possible?
creator: tbray1

title: STMP Timeout with Cpanel email
content:
I have a custom email that I use for work and I was not able to get it working on Thunderbird. When I add the email/password, it detects the settings and then says it cannot confirm the password.

To workaround this, I only add the email, and then when it detects settings, it asks me to input the password. And when I do that, it adds the account and attempts to read my incoming STMP server. I get an error that it times out. And when I try to send emails, it says it cannot access the outgoing STMP.

I use cpanel and when I access my email via roundcube, it shows me my messages. I have cloudflare set up via namecheap with the correct DNS records. My other email clients (gmail/outlook) work fine. I have reinstalled thunderbird so Im not sure what else I can do

title: searching old (ancient) archives
content:
Using Thunderbird 128.7.1esr under Windows 11. I've got a batch of ancient mail that I would like to search. The archive is sitting on an external drive with folders named *. sbd, files named *.msf, and files with no extension. A quick peek at some of those with no extension reveals e-mail messages of the kind I'd like to be able to search.

I seem to recall being able to open such archives from within Thunderbird, but it was decades ago and I'm a little lost. EDIT: I just reinstalled ImportExportTools NG, but I don't see how to proceed.

How can I open or import these? Again, I just want to be able to browse and search.

Many thanks, Jeanne
creator: JeanneR

title: Message dates on Inbox always on same month
content:
Dear Support Team,

I recently recovered a disk from an older laptop and successfully exported all messages to my new system running macOS X Monterey (12.7.6). The installation was done from scratch, without having Thunderbird installed previously. I am currently using Thunderbird 128.7.1esr (64-bit). However, I am encountering an issue where all messages—whether old or new—are appearing in the same month, despite the actual date they were sent.

When sorting by date, the inbox sorts correctly, but all messages display with the same month (April), regardless of when they were received. This issue occurs across all folders (Inbox, Sent, Drafts, Archives, and any local folders). While the day and year are accurate, the month always shows as April.

I have verified the date and time settings on macOS, which are set to automatic, and the region matches the settings in Thunderbird. I have also run the "Repair Folder" option on the Inbox folder properties, but the issue persists across all folders.

Do you have any suggestions for resolving this?

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

Best regards,
creator: leonardo17

title: Emails received in Thunderbird from a known good sender have URL's that are never hyperlinks?
content:
I have been asking for a help to fix this issue for a long time.

If these questions are read by the Thunderbird developers, I would hope someone would respond.

Why would an email from a sender listed in my contacts, who sends me a URL link to a website NOT colored blue and clickable as a hyperlink?

It seems like my previous requests for a fix about this issue was nothing but crickets. I am not a software developer, but retired hardware engineer, so I know a little about hyperlinks. My Email provider is AOL, and URL links come in properly as URL address, but they are 'not hyperlinks' that I can just click on to redirect me to that website, and view what is sent to me with a new tab. If I change (View Message body) AS, TEXT, then the URL address in the email turns into a hyperlink and is then clickable. Really TEXT??? Its not text, I think this is a bug. Why would I have to change from View Message AS "Original HTML", my default view each time I want to view the link. Note the email body has a URL address the for redirect with HTML code, see below.

Example: https://www.instagram.com/share/p/_8Z8M_PJR

I have been a member of this group for well over 10 years and I donate each year, but I plan to postpone any further donations until I receive support for something that should be a simple fix. AOL.com email in the inbox over the web, the URL is shown as a hyperlink, (blue), thunderbird is not showing it as hyperlink?

Community support is welcome, Eric S.
creator: cfogri1

title: Saved message not visible in Drafts (But Search says it's there.)
content:
I run TBird 128.7.1 Under Win 11-64.

Yesterday, I started writing, and editing, a detailed message, and then clicked to Save it, planning further editing today.

A few minutes ago, I opened my Account's Drafts folder, but was unable to find the message after sorting the folder every which way. Next, I opened Local Folders Drafts, and found it empty.

At that point, I entered the message's Subject in the CNTL-K Search field, and found the message (Whew...!) but I still did not know where it was hiding, so, I clicked Show As List, and learned that the message was located in my Account's Drafts folder, just as it should be.

The good news is that I can complete the editing of the message. The bad news is that I am still unable to locate the message in Drafts directly. I must search for it using CNTL-K.

What might be causing this disappearing act? And how might I prevent it?

Many thanks,

Lothar
creator: lotharkrepke
